title: Citi Awarded "Best Bank in China" by The Asset for Seventh Year in Row
summary: Shanghai - Citi China is proud to have retained the coveted "Best Bank in China" award at The Asset Triple A Country Awards 2013 for seventh year in row.
tag-1: Citi Awarded "Best Bank in China" by The Asset for Seventh Year in Row
tag-2: Shanghai – Citi China is proud to have retained the coveted "Best Bank in China" award at The Asset Triple A Country Awards 2013 for seventh year in row.
tag-3: Now into its second decade, the Triple A Country Awards are highly regarded by the industry throughout Asia Pacific as a yardstick for leadership in the financial industry.
tag-4: Andrew Au, Chief Executive Officer for Citi China, said, "It is gratifying to receive such a significant credit that recognizes our relentless strive towards excellence and reaffirms our industry leadership. I am immensely proud of our colleagues who focus on client excellence, ensure we practice responsible finance and work to build Citi China into the most respected and customer-focused bank through leadership and ingenuity even in tough market conditions."
tag-5: Commenting on the decision to grant Citi China the award, the editors of The Asset noted, "In China, Citi has clear leadership across multiple business lines from corporate and commercial banking to investment, consumer and transaction banking."
tag-6: As Citi enters into its third century, 2013 has witnessed Citi China making significant progress on a number of fronts. Several notable achievements include being one of the first foreign banks to receive approval to prepare for establishment in the China (Shanghai) Pilot Free Trade Zone; one of the first foreign banks to offer domestic mutual funds; and bringing innovative trade and treasury solutions in payment collection and Renminbi cross-border settlement. All these have reinforced Citi's leadership among foreign banks in China.
tag-7: Today, Citi offers the broadest product range of any international bank in China. On the corporate banking front, Citi continues to play a key role in supporting Chinese companies pursue their strategic goals and has helped raise billions of dollars in capital to support these needs. In 2013, Citi further expanded its "China Desks" in Africa, Latin America, Russia and Southeast Asia, covering nine markets in total. Citi maintains a market-leading position in serving multinational companies doing business in China and also leads the industry in the provision of integrated cash management, trade and treasury, and securities and fund services. Citi China's consumer banking continues to expand product offering and provide its customers with comprehensive and industry-leading wealth management service that is innovative, value-added and world-class.
tag-8: Besides China, Citi also won the Best Bank award in India, Indonesia, Korea, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand and Vietnam, making a record haul of awards in this year's Triple A Country Awards from The Asset magazine, and strengthening its leadership across Asia Pacific.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-10: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://blog.citigroup.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-11: Citi China Citi first established an office in China on May 15, 1902, in Shanghai. In April 2007, Citi was among the first international banks to locally incorporate in China. Citi's locally incorporated entity is known as Citibank (China) Co Ltd, which is wholly owned by Citibank N.A. Today Citi is a leading international bank in China and has 13 corporate bank branches – in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chongqing, Guiyang, Nanjing, Changsha and Wuxi – and 52 consumer bank outlets. With operations in more than 160 countries around the world, Citi is the most global of all international banks in China.
